course_title: Cost Effectiveness in Health and Medicine

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the methods, techniques and use of cost-effectiveness analysis in health care.
Comprehend the more complex methodological issues inherent in cost-effectiveness analysis in health care.
Undertake a cost-effectiveness analysis of competing health care interventions.
Critically analyse and appraise the strengths and weaknesses of an economic evaluation.
Demonstrate skills in written communication and group work/collaboration.

assessments.task_description: A combination of short answer questions and reflections for the first 3 weeks (introductory knowledge about health economics and cost effectiveness analysis in health care). Each week, students are requested to complete and submit the journal via Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Complete the journal in HP5, download it and submit in Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Appraisal of an economic evaluation study
assessments.task_description:
In Assessment 2, you will be asked to complete an evaluation of a published economic evaluation study. There are two parts: 

Part 1 – Individual Assessment: Read the assigned paper and complete the CHEERS checklist.  

Part 2 – Group Assessment: With your group members, prepare and present a short discussion about the reporting quality of the assigned paper and reflect on what can be improved.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.weighting: <dd>50% [2 parts: 25% Excel model, and 25% cost effectiveness analysis report] </dd>
assessments.task_description: Conduct an economic evaluation using Excel, designed to examine all learning outcomes. The project description will be released in week 5. From Week 6, there will be 1-hour practical session (during the regular contact hour: Wednesday 1-4pm), where students learn to develop a Markov model in Excel and use this model to conduct a cost-effectiveness analysis. During the practical session, students are encouraged to work with each other (facilitated by the teaching team).
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Workshops

Interactive lectures and tutorials in a workshop format. These will include: student-led discussions, presentations, in-class group work, and practical exercises in Excel. The practical exercise in Excel will start in week 6, and run for 1 hour per week. It is designed to support students to develop their term project.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
